author: Staff Reporter
text:
In a move to provide young adults with special needs a means of livelihood, V Excel educational trust launched its vocation-based livelihood training at their Mylapore campus on Monday.

The trust has partnered with Wassup Ondemand Laundry Brand to offer training to those with autism, Down syndrome and other genetic disorders.

“The need of the hour today is livelihood-based training, where they can earn a decent sum for their service. So, we decided to address this need through our partnership venture,” said Vasudha Prakash, Founder Trustee of V Excel, an NGO that works for child welfare.

Trainees will engage and be trained in laundry and dry cleaning which includes collection, washing, ironing, checking, packing and delivery.

The initiative can also be partnered by other people from the city.

“This will help them in developing their skills,” she said.
title: Vocational training for special children
